DataFrame Type aliases

ASerie

ASerie: Serie<IArray>

SerieInfo

SerieInfo: { serie: Serie<IArray> | undefined; transfertPolicy?: string; userData?: any }

Type declaration

  • serie: Serie<IArray> | undefined
  • Optional transfertPolicy?: string
  • Optional userData?: any

Algorithms Functions

Const filter

  • filter(s: Serie<IArray>, callback: Function): Serie<IArray>

  • filter a Serie using a callback function.

    note

    Operations are done using the items

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • callback: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const forEach

  • forEach(s: Serie<IArray>, callback: Function): void
  • note

    Operations are done using the items

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • callback: Function

    Returns void

Const map

  • map(s: Serie<IArray>, callback: Function): Serie<IArray>

  • map a Serie onto another one using a map function.

    note

    Operations are done using the items

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • callback: Function

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const reduce

  • reduce(series: ASerie | ASerie[], callback: Function): Serie<any>
  • example
    const A = df.get('A')
const y = df.get('y')
const reduced = reduce([A,y], ([m,x]) => {
    let vec = vector(x)
    let mat = smatrix(m, 3, 3) // sym matrix rank 2
    return mat.transpose().multVec( vector(vec).normalize() ).array
})

    Parameters

    • series: ASerie | ASerie[]
    • callback: Function

    Returns Serie<any>

    a new ASerie

Array Functions

dectectNan

  • dectectNan(array: IArray): IArray

  • Return the indices from array that contain NaN values

    Parameters

    • array: IArray

      The array of number

    Returns IArray

  • flatten(array: number[][]): number[]

  • Parameters

    Returns number

minMaxArray

  • minMaxArray(array: IArray): number[]

  • Parameters

    • array: IArray

    Returns number[]

normalize

  • normalize(array: IArray): IArray

  • Parameters

    • array: IArray

    Returns IArray

scaleArray

  • scaleArray(array: IArray, s: number): IArray

  • Parameters

    • array: IArray
    • s: number

    Returns IArray

Creation Functions

createArray

  • createArray(length: number, init?: Function | number): any[]

  • Create an Array of a given length and with an initial value set for all entries

    example
    const array1 = create(100, i => i**2)
const array2 = create(100, 0)
const array3 = create(100)

    Parameters

    • length: number

      The length of the array

    • init: Function | number = ...

      A function that has to be called for initialization, a number, or nothing

    Returns any[]

createEmptySerie

  • createEmptySerie<T>(__namedParameters: { Type?: any; count: number; itemSize?: number; shared?: boolean }): Serie<any[]> | Serie<T>

  • Create a serie from scratch given a type (Array or TypedArray) and a rowsCount. Passed parameters are:

    {
     Type, // Can be either an Array or a TypedArray.
     count, // The number of elements in the array
     itemSize, // The size of each items (length of the array will be rowsCount*itemSize)
     shared // If the TypedArray should be a SharedArrayBuffer or an ArrayBuffer
}

    Type parameters

    • T: IArray

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: { Type?: any; count: number; itemSize?: number; shared?: boolean }
      • Optional Type?: any
      • count: number
      • Optional itemSize?: number
      • Optional shared?: boolean

    Returns Serie<any[]> | Serie<T>

    The newly created Serie

createSerie

  • createSerie<T>(data: T, itemSize?: number): Serie<T>

  • Create a serie given an array (Array or TypedArray with ArrayBuffer or SharedArrayBuffer).

    example
    const coordinates = [0,3,2,7,4,8,6,5,2]

// s1 is a serie supporting a SharedArrayBuffer
const s1 = createSerie(createTyped(Float32Array, coordinates, true), 3)

// s2 is a serie supporting an ArrayBuffer
const s2 = createSerie(createTyped(Float64Array, coordinates, false), 3)

// s3 is an Array
const s3 = createSerie(coordinates, 3)

    Type parameters

    • T: IArray

    Parameters

    • data: T

      The array

    • itemSize: number = 1

      The item size. The length of T should be a multiple of itemSize

    Returns Serie<T>

    The newly created Serie

createTyped

  • createTyped(Type: any, data: number | number[], shared: boolean): any

  • Create a TypedArray of a given length (number of entries) that can be shared or not. The length is either provided directly, or by an array that will be used to initialize the type array.

    example
    const sharedArray = createTyped(Float32Array, 100, true)
const array       = createTyped(Float32Array, [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9], false)

    Parameters

    • Type: any

      The type of the array:

      • Int8Array
      • Uint8Array
      • Uint8ClampedArray
      • Int16Array
      • Uint16Array
      • Int32Array
      • Uint32Array
      • Float32Array
      • Float64Array
      • BigInt64Array
      • BigUint64Array
    • data: number | number[]

      The number of entries or an array of number

    • shared: boolean

      If the Typed has SharedArrayBuffer or not

    Returns any

Math Functions

Const add

  • add(s: Serie<IArray>, ...others: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]): Serie<IArray>

  • Add several Series to generate a new one

    example
    // perform: a = b + c
const a = add(
    df.get('b'),
    df.get('c'),
)
    example
    // perform: a = 0.1*b + 0.3*c + 0.7*d
const a = add(
    mult( df.get('b'), 0.1),
    mult( df.get('c'), 0.3),
    mult( df.get('d'), 0.7)
)

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • Rest ...others: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const div

  • div(s: Serie<IArray>, ...others: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]): Serie<IArray>
  • example
    // perform a = b/c/d
const a = div( df.get('b'), df.get('c'), df.get('d') )

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • Rest ...others: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const eigenValue

  • eigenValue(s: Serie<IArray>): Serie<any>

  • Get eigen values

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<any>

Const eigenVector

  • eigenVector(s: Serie<IArray>): Serie<any>

  • Get eigen vectors. itemSize of the returned Serie is therefore 9 and the coordinates of the three eigen vectors are classified as follow: [v1x,v1y,v1z, v2x,v2y,v2z, v3x, v3y, v3z]

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<any>

Const mean

  • mean(s: Serie<IArray>): Serie<any>

  • Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<any>

Const mult

  • mult(s: Serie<IArray>, ...args: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]): Serie<IArray>
  • example

    Perform: a = b + b + d where b, c and d are vectors of size 3

    let df = new DataFrame()
     .set('b', createSerie(new Array(20).fill(2), 3))
     .set('c', createSerie(new Array(20).fill(3), 3))
     .set('d', createSerie(new Array(20).fill(3), 3))

const a = mult( df.get('b'), df.get('c'), df.get('d') )
    example

    Perform: a = 0.1*b + 0.3*c + 0.7*d

    let df = new DataFrame()
     .set('b', createSerie(new Array(20).fill(2), 6))
     .set('c', createSerie(new Array(20).fill(3), 6))
     .set('d', createSerie(new Array(20).fill(3), 6))

const a = add(
    mult( df.get('b'), 0.1),
    mult( df.get('c'), 0.3),
    mult( df.get('d'), 0.7)
)

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • Rest ...args: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Const norm

  • norm(s: Serie<IArray>): Serie<any>

  • Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<any>

Const sub

  • sub(s: Serie<IArray>, ...others: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]): Serie<IArray>

  • Subtract several Series to generate a new one

    example
    // perform: a = b - c
const a = sub(
    df.get('b'),
    df.get('c'),
)

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>
    • Rest ...others: (number | Serie<IArray>)[]

    Returns Serie<IArray>

trace

  • trace(s: Serie<IArray> | undefined): Serie<any>

  • Get the trace of symmetric matrices of size:

    • 6: [xx, xy, xz, yy, yz, zz]
    • 9: [xx, xy, xz, yx, yy, yz, zx, zy, zz]

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray> | undefined

    Returns Serie<any>

Const transpose

  • transpose(s: Serie<IArray>): Serie<IArray>

  • Only transpose matrix in the form of arrays of size 9

    Parameters

    • s: Serie<IArray>

    Returns Serie<IArray>

Utils Functions

Const exists

  • exists(df: DataFrame, name: string): boolean

  • Check if a TypedArray exist in the DataFrame

    Parameters

    • df: DataFrame
    • name: string

    Returns boolean

Const info

  • info(df: DataFrame | Serie<IArray>): any

  • Parameters

    • df: DataFrame | Serie<IArray>

    Returns any
